00067       //  initialization data for list of metrics
00068       struct init_data

00079     
00084   class SAGA_EXPORT metric 
00085     : public saga::object,
00086       public saga::detail::attribute<metric>
00087   {
00088    protected:
00090      TR1::shared_ptr <saga::impl::metric> get_impl (void) const;
00091 
00092      friend struct saga::detail::attribute<metric>;  // needs to access get_impl()
00093      friend class saga::impl::metric;
00094 
00095      explicit metric(saga::impl::metric *impl);
00097 
00098    public:
00103      enum frequency 
00104      {
00105        Unknown  = -1,
00106        Cont     =  0,  // always available
00107        Descreet =  1,  // available at specific intervals
00108        Pull     =  2,  // available when asked for
00109        Push     =  3,  // available when set
00110        Event    =  4   // available when a specific event occurs
00111      };
00112 
00117      typedef saga::monitorable::cookie_handle metric_cookie;
00118 
00123      metric (void);
00124      
00129      explicit metric (saga::object const& o);
00130 
00135      // FIXME: the spec does not say anything about a target object parameter.
00136      // In fact, a metric should be usable on multiple objects.  For example, an
00137      // application may want to add the same metrics to several steerable
00138      // job instances.
00139      metric (saga::object target, 
00140              std::string name, std::string desc, std::string mode, 
00141              std::string unit, std::string type, std::string val);
00142              
00147     ~metric (void);
00148 
00153      metric &operator= (saga::object const& o);
00154 
00159      void fire (saga::context ctx = saga::context());
00160 
00165      metric_cookie add_callback (saga::callback f);
00166      
00171      void remove_callback (metric_cookie cookie);
00172      
00177      friend SAGA_EXPORT 
00178      bool operator== (metric const & lhs, metric const & rhs);
00179 
00180   };

00183   typedef std::vector <saga::metric> metric_list_type;
